references:
To address the issue of man-in-the-middle attacks and improve parameter communication efficiency during the training process of federated learning models, this article proposes the FBChain model based on federated learning and blockchain. FBChain is based on a blockchain network,
assume there have
nodes in the blockchain network. The model is defined as follows:
, represents the set of global model aggregation packaging nodes, where
represents the set of positive integers. The
nodes are responsible for aggregating the local model parameters (
) in federated learning and packaging transactions into blockchain.
, represents the set of local training nodes, where
nodes have their own data sets.
, represents the blockchain propagation nodes, where
nodes number. The blockchain propagation nodes do not participate in the federated learning training process but only propagation blocks.
represents the local parameter update round,
who aggregated the global model, and
represents the global parameter update round. The unified
is obtained by aggregating local parameters.

represents Proof of Weighted Link Speed consensus algorithm, which comprehensively consider nodes’ link speed and transmission delay in the blockchain network to obtain a weighted value, as the basis for selecting nodes to be
, improve the communication efficiency in the FBChain.

represents the node number. In the model, the credit score evaluates the node’s performance in the federated learning training process. The higher the credit score, the better the node’s local model performance in the global model aggregation process.
